Assessment Questionc back to ToC or Class ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/AssessmentQuestion

Represents the set of questions used to perform a gap analysis to assess compliance against ISO 27001:2022 controls and the NIS2 Cybersecurity Measures.
Is defined by
http://JP_ontology.org/assessment
has super-classes
I S O Control270012022 c
has sub-classes

  • Multiple Choice Question #98
  • Multiple Choice Question #99

MCQ.1 - Fully Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ1AnswerC

The organisation thoroughly identifies external and internal issues relevant to its purpose and assesses their impact on achieving the intended outcomes of its information security management system, ensuring proactive management and alignment with organisational goals.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #1 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(iii)"@en
definition ap "The organisation thoroughly identifies external and internal issues relevant to its purpose and assesses their impact on achieving the intended outcomes of its information security management system, ensuring proactive management and alignment with organisational goals."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.1 - Fully Implemented"@en

MCQ.1 - Not Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ1AnswerA

The organisation does not actively identify external and internal issues relevant to its purpose or their potential impact on achieving the intended outcomes of its information security management system.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #1 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(i)"@en
definition ap "The organisation does not actively identify external and internal issues relevant to its purpose or their potential impact on achieving the intended outcomes of its information security management system."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.1 - Not Implemented"@en

MCQ.1 - Partially Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ1AnswerB

There are some efforts to determine external and internal issues relevant to the organisation's purpose and their impact on achieving the intended outcomes of its information security management system, but the process may be inconsistent or incomplete.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #1 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(ii)"@en
definition ap "There are some efforts to determine external and internal issues relevant to the organisation's purpose and their impact on achieving the intended outcomes of its information security management system, but the process may be inconsistent or incomplete."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.1 - Partially Implemented"@en

MCQ.10.1 - Fully Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ.10.1AnswerC

The information security policy and topic-specific policies are fully defined, approved by management, published, communicated to, and acknowledged by relevant personnel and interested parties, ensuring widespread awareness and compliance with security requirements.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #10.1 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(iii)"@en
definition ap "The information security policy and topic-specific policies are fully defined, approved by management, published, communicated to, and acknowledged by relevant personnel and interested parties, ensuring widespread awareness and compliance with security requirements."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.10.1 - Fully Implemented"@en

MCQ.10.1 - Not Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ.10.1AnswerA

The information security policy and topic-specific policies are not defined, approved by management, published, communicated to, or acknowledged by relevant personnel and interested parties, potentially leading to confusion and lack of awareness regarding security requirements.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #10.1 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(i)"@en
definition ap "The information security policy and topic-specific policies are not defined, approved by management, published, communicated to, or acknowledged by relevant personnel and interested parties, potentially leading to confusion and lack of awareness regarding security requirements."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.10.1 - Not Implemented"@en

MCQ.10.1 - Partially Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ.10.1AnswerB

There are some efforts to define, approve, publish, communicate, and acknowledge the information security policy and topic-specific policies. However, these efforts may be inconsistent or not fully comprehensive across all relevant parties.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #10.1 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(ii)"@en
definition ap "There are some efforts to define, approve, publish, communicate, and acknowledge the information security policy and topic-specific policies. However, these efforts may be inconsistent or not fully comprehensive across all relevant parties."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.10.1 - Partially Implemented"@en

MCQ.10.2 - Fully Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ10.2AnswerC

The policy is fully reviewed at planned intervals and if significant changes occur, ensuring that it remains up-to-date, relevant, and aligned with the organisation's objectives and evolving security landscape.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #10.2 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(iii)"@en
definition ap "The policy is fully reviewed at planned intervals and if significant changes occur, ensuring that it remains up-to-date, relevant, and aligned with the organisation's objectives and evolving security landscape."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.10.2 - Fully Implemented"@en

MCQ.10.2 - Not Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ10.2AnswerA

The policy is not reviewed at planned intervals or if significant changes occur, potentially leading to outdated or ineffective security measures that do not align with evolving threats and organisational needs.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #10.2 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(i)"@en
definition ap "The policy is not reviewed at planned intervals or if significant changes occur, potentially leading to outdated or ineffective security measures that do not align with evolving threats and organisational needs."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.10.2 - Not Implemented"@en

MCQ.10.2 - Partially Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ10.2AnswerB

There are some efforts to review the policy at planned intervals or if significant changes occur. However, these reviews may not be consistently conducted or may lack thoroughness in assessing the policy's relevance and effectiveness.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #10.2 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(ii)"@en
definition ap "There are some efforts to review the policy at planned intervals or if significant changes occur. However, these reviews may not be consistently conducted or may lack thoroughness in assessing the policy's relevance and effectiveness."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.10.2 - Partially Implemented"@en

MCQ.100 - Fully Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ100AnswerC

Data leakage prevention measures are fully applied to systems, networks, and other devices that process, store, or transmit sensitive information, ensuring protection against unauthorized disclosure or leakage of sensitive data.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #100 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(iii)"@en
definition ap "Data leakage prevention measures are fully applied to systems, networks, and other devices that process, store, or transmit sensitive information, ensuring protection against unauthorized disclosure or leakage of sensitive data."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.100 - Fully Implemented"@en

MCQ.100 - Not Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ100AnswerA

Data leakage prevention measures are not applied to systems, networks, and other devices that process, store, or transmit sensitive information, leaving the data vulnerable to unauthorized disclosure or leakage.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #100 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(i)"@en
definition ap "Data leakage prevention measures are not applied to systems, networks, and other devices that process, store, or transmit sensitive information, leaving the data vulnerable to unauthorized disclosure or leakage."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.100 - Not Implemented"@en

MCQ.100 - Partially Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ100AnswerB

There are some efforts to apply data leakage prevention measures to systems, networks, and other devices that handle sensitive information, but the implementation may be inconsistent or not fully comprehensive.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #100 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(ii)"@en
definition ap "There are some efforts to apply data leakage prevention measures to systems, networks, and other devices that handle sensitive information, but the implementation may be inconsistent or not fully comprehensive."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.100 - Partially Implemented"@en

MCQ.101 - Fully Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ101AnswerC

The organisation actively identifies and assesses both external and internal issues relevant to its information security management system, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of potential impacts and enabling proactive measures to be taken to address them effectively.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #101 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(iii)"@en
definition ap "The organisation actively identifies and assesses both external and internal issues relevant to its information security management system, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of potential impacts and enabling proactive measures to be taken to address them effectively."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.101 - Fully Implemented"@en

MCQ.101 - Not Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ101AnswerA

The organisation does not systematically identify or address external and internal issues relevant to its information security management system, leaving it vulnerable to unforeseen challenges.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #101 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(i)"@en
definition ap "The organisation does not systematically identify or address external and internal issues relevant to its information security management system, leaving it vulnerable to unforeseen challenges."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.101 - Not Implemented"@en

MCQ.101 - Partially Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ101AnswerB

Some efforts are made to identify external and internal issues, but the process lacks thoroughness or consistency, resulting in gaps in understanding potential impacts on the information security management system.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #101 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(ii)"@en
definition ap "Some efforts are made to identify external and internal issues, but the process lacks thoroughness or consistency, resulting in gaps in understanding potential impacts on the information security management system."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.101 - Partially Implemented"@en

MCQ.102 - Fully Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ102AnswerC

The organisation systematically identifies interested parties, their requirements, and determines which requirements will be addressed through the information security management system, ensuring alignment with stakeholder needs and expectations.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #102 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(iii)"@en
definition ap "The organisation systematically identifies interested parties, their requirements, and determines which requirements will be addressed through the information security management system, ensuring alignment with stakeholder needs and expectations."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.102 - Fully Implemented"@en

MCQ.102 - Not Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ102AnswerA

The organisation does not identify interested parties or their requirements, leading to a lack of alignment between the information security management system and stakeholder expectations.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #102 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(i)"@en
definition ap "The organisation does not identify interested parties or their requirements, leading to a lack of alignment between the information security management system and stakeholder expectations."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.102 - Not Implemented"@en

MCQ.102 - Partially Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ102AnswerB

Some interested parties and their requirements are identified, but there is inconsistency in the process, resulting in gaps in understanding and addressing all relevant requirements.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #102 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(ii)"@en
definition ap "Some interested parties and their requirements are identified, but there is inconsistency in the process, resulting in gaps in understanding and addressing all relevant requirements."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.102 - Partially Implemented"@en

MCQ.103 - Fully Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ103AnswerC

The organisation systematically considers external and internal issues, requirements, and interfaces with other organisations when determining the scope of its ISMS, ensuring clarity and alignment with organisational objectives. The scope is documented and readily available for reference.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #103 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(iii)"@en
definition ap "The organisation systematically considers external and internal issues, requirements, and interfaces with other organisations when determining the scope of its ISMS, ensuring clarity and alignment with organisational objectives. The scope is documented and readily available for reference."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.103 - Fully Implemented"@en

MCQ.103 - Not Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ103AnswerA

The organisation does not consider external and internal issues, requirements, or interfaces with other organisations when determining the scope of its ISMS, resulting in an unclear or inadequate scope.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #103 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(i)"@en
definition ap "The organisation does not consider external and internal issues, requirements, or interfaces with other organisations when determining the scope of its ISMS, resulting in an unclear or inadequate scope."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.103 - Not Implemented"@en

belongs to

has facts

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ104AnswerC

The organisation has robust processes in place to systematically establish, implement, maintain, and continually improve its ISMS in strict accordance with the requirements outlined in ISO27001, ensuring comprehensive security measures are in place and effectively managed.

has facts

MCQ.109 - Fully Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ109AnswerC

The organisation systematically controls documented information to ensure its availability, suitability for use, and adequate protection from loss of confidentiality, improper use, or loss of integrity. This includes addressing activities such as distribution, access, retrieval, use, storage, preservation, change control, retention, and disposition, as applicable. Additionally, documented information of external origin necessary for the ISMS is identified and controlled appropriately.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #109 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(iii)"@en
definition ap "The organisation systematically controls documented information to ensure its availability, suitability for use, and adequate protection from loss of confidentiality, improper use, or loss of integrity. This includes addressing activities such as distribution, access, retrieval, use, storage, preservation, change control, retention, and disposition, as applicable. Additionally, documented information of external origin necessary for the ISMS is identified and controlled appropriately."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.109 - Fully Implemented"@en

Planned changes are controlled, and consequences of unintended changes are reviewed, with necessary actions taken to mitigate adverse effects. Additionally, externally provided processes, products, or services relevant to the ISMS are controlled.

MCQ.112.1 - Fully Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ112.1AnswerC

The organisation systematically determines what needs to be monitored and measured, establishes methods for monitoring and measurement that produce comparable and reproducible results, specifies when and by whom monitoring and measurement should be performed, and analyzes and evaluates the results.
belongs to

has facts
alt Label ap "(iii)"@en
definition ap "The organisation systematically determines what needs to be monitored and measured, establishes methods for monitoring and measurement that produce comparable and reproducible results, specifies when and by whom monitoring and measurement should be performed, and analyzes and evaluates the results."@en

MCQ.112.1 - Not Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ112.1AnswerA

belongs to

has facts

has facts
alt Label ap "(ii)"@en

Multiple Choice Question #112.2 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(i)"@en
definition ap "The organisation lacks a systematic approach to evaluating information security performance and ISMS effectiveness, resulting in a lack of understanding of the system's performance and effectiveness."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.112.2 - Not Implemented"@en

MCQ.112.2 - Partially Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ112.2AnswerB

Some effort is made to evaluate information security performance and ISMS effectiveness, but there are inconsistencies or gaps in the evaluation process, leading to limited insights into the system's performance and effectiveness.
belongs to

has facts

definition ap "Some effort is made to evaluate information security performance and ISMS effectiveness, but there are inconsistencies or gaps in the evaluation process, leading to limited insights into the system's performance and effectiveness."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.112.2 - Partially Implemented"@en

MCQ.113 - Fully Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ113AnswerC

The organisation conducts internal audits at planned intervals to assess conformity to its own requirements and the requirements of relevant documents, as well as the effectiveness of ISMS implementation and maintenance. This ensures a comprehensive evaluation of the ISMS.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #113 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(iii)"@en
definition ap "The organisation conducts internal audits at planned intervals to assess conformity to its own requirements and the requirements of relevant documents, as well as the effectiveness of ISMS implementation and maintenance. This ensures a comprehensive evaluation of the ISMS."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.113 - Fully Implemented"@en

MCQ.113 - Not Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ113AnswerA

The organisation does not conduct internal audits at planned intervals to assess conformity to its own requirements and the requirements of relevant documents, nor does it evaluate the effectiveness of ISMS implementation and maintenance.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #113 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(i)"@en

pref Label ap "MCQ.113 - Not Implemented"@en

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ113AnswerB

Some internal audits are conducted to assess conformity to the organisation's own requirements and relevant documents, as well as the effectiveness of ISMS implementation and maintenance. However, there are inconsistencies or gaps in the audit process.
belongs to

has facts

pref Label ap "MCQ.113 - Partially Implemented"@en

MCQ.114 - Fully Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ114AnswerC

The organisation plans, establishes, implements, and maintains an audit program, including defined frequency, methods, responsibilities, planning requirements, and reporting. Consideration is given to the importance of processes and results of previous audits. Auditors are selected to ensure objectivity and impartiality, and audit results are reported to relevant management. Documented information is available as evidence of the implementation of the audit program and the audit results.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #114 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(iii)"@en
definition ap "The organisation plans, establishes, implements, and maintains an audit program, including defined frequency, methods, responsibilities, planning requirements, and reporting. Consideration is given to the importance of processes and results of previous audits. Auditors are selected to ensure objectivity and impartiality, and audit results are reported to relevant management. Documented information is available as evidence of the implementation of the audit program and the audit results."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.114 - Fully Implemented"@en

MCQ.114 - Not Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ114AnswerA

The organisation lacks a planned, established, implemented, and maintained audit program, including defined frequency, methods, responsibilities, planning requirements, and reporting. Additionally, there is no consideration given to the importance of processes or results of previous audits.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #114 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(i)"@en
definition ap "The organisation lacks a planned, established, implemented, and maintained audit program, including defined frequency, methods, responsibilities, planning requirements, and reporting. Additionally, there is no consideration given to the importance of processes or results of previous audits."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.114 - Not Implemented"@en

MCQ.114 - Partially Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ114AnswerB

Some efforts are made to establish an audit program, but there are inconsistencies or gaps in defining frequency, methods, responsibilities, planning requirements, and reporting. There is partial consideration of the importance of processes and results of previous audits.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #114 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(ii)"@en

pref Label ap "MCQ.114 - Partially Implemented"@en

MCQ.115 - Fully Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ115AnswerC

Senior management systematically conducts reviews of the information security management system at planned intervals, ensuring its continuing suitability, adequacy, and effectiveness. This ensures that the ISMS remains aligned with organisational goals and adapts to changes in the internal and external environment.
belongs to

has facts

MCQ.118 - Fully Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ118AnswerC

The organisation reacts to nonconformities by taking action to control and correct them, addressing consequences, evaluating causes to prevent recurrence, implementing necessary actions, reviewing the effectiveness of corrective actions, and making changes to the ISMS if necessary. Corrective actions are appropriate to the effects of the nonconformities encountered. Documented information is available as evidence of the nature of nonconformities, subsequent actions taken, and the results of corrective actions.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #118 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(iii)"@en
definition ap "The organisation reacts to nonconformities by taking action to control and correct them, addressing consequences, evaluating causes to prevent recurrence, implementing necessary actions, reviewing the effectiveness of corrective actions, and making changes to the ISMS if necessary. Corrective actions are appropriate to the effects of the nonconformities encountered. Documented information is available as evidence of the nature of nonconformities, subsequent actions taken, and the results of corrective actions."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.118 - Fully Implemented"@en

has facts

has facts

definition ap "The organisation fully determines what needs to be monitored and measured, including information security processes and controls, ensuring comprehensive oversight and assessment of security measures' effectiveness."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.49.1 - Fully Implemented"@en

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ55.3AnswerA

Persons doing work under the organisations control are not aware of the implications of not conforming with the information security management system requirements, potentially leading to inadvertent non-compliance and increased security risks.
belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #55.3 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(i)"@en
definition ap "Persons doing work under the organisations control are not aware of the implications of not conforming with the information security management system requirements, potentially leading to inadvertent non-compliance and increased security risks."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ.55.3 - Not Implemented"@en

MCQ.55.3 - Partially Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ55.3AnswerB

MCQ.65 - Fully Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ65AnswerC

Protection against malware is fully implemented and supported by appropriate user awareness measures, ensuring proactive defence against malware threats and enhancing overall security posture.
belongs to

has facts

IRI: http://JP_ontology.org/assessment/MCQ99AnswerA

belongs to

has facts

belongs to
Multiple Choice Question #70.1 c
has facts
alt Label ap "(ii)"
definition ap "There are some efforts to determine the required competence of individuals performing work under its control that affects its information security performance, but the process may be inconsistent or not fully comprehensive."@en
pref Label ap "MCQ70.1. Partially Implemented"

MCQ91.1. Not Implementedni back to ToC or Named Individual ToC

has facts
